edu.mbhs.madubozhi.touhou.audio

Class SoundEffect

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.mbhs.madubozhi.touhou.audio.SoundEffect

  • public class SoundEffect
extends java.lang.Object
    Class used to manage SFX. It utilizes the Clip class in javax.sound to play the effects. Each sound effect is indexed, with the index of each sound effect specified in ./audio/sfx.txt, where each listed file, included in ./audio/sfx/ is given the index n - 1, where n is the line number the file is listed.
    Author:
    Bowen Zhi and Matt Du

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SoundEffect()
      Instantiates a SoundEffect with the default ID 0
      SoundEffect(int ID)
      Instantiates a SoundEffect with the specified ID

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int getID() 
      void play()
      Begins playing this sound effect.
      void playToStop()
      Begins playing this sound effect, and continues until the sound effect file has finished playing, at which time the Clip is automatically closed, and the Thread terminated.
      void setID(int ID)
      Reads in a new sound effect at the specified ID
      void stop()
      Closes the Clip, halting this sound effect

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • SoundEffect

        public SoundEffect()
        Instantiates a SoundEffect with the default ID 0

      • SoundEffect

        public SoundEffect(int ID)
        Instantiates a SoundEffect with the specified ID
        Parameters:
        ID - index corresponding to a sound effect

    • Method Detail

      • play

        public void play()
        Begins playing this sound effect. Note that to prevent memory leaks, one must call the stop() method afterwards to clear the Clip from memory.

      • playToStop

        public void playToStop()
        Begins playing this sound effect, and continues until the sound effect file has finished playing, at which time the Clip is automatically closed, and the Thread terminated.

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Closes the Clip, halting this sound effect

      • setID

        public void setID(int ID)
        Reads in a new sound effect at the specified ID
        Parameters:
        ID - index corresponding to a sound effect

      • getID

        public int getID()
        Returns:
        index corresponding to the current playing sound effect
